website_summaries.verdict: Aimed at kids under age 6, this simple wooden doll with magnetic pieces teaches what the human anatomy looks like and how it is structured.
pros: Both boy and girl doll are included
Muscles, skeleton, and organs are clearly depicted
cons: Dolls are anatomically correct, which some parents may not be prepared for
Magnets do not stack on top of one another

customer_reviews.title: This package comes with a package.
customer_reviews.text: Everything Melissa & Doug makes is awesome. The artwork is always great and the toys are sturdy. Which is great for the really small ones. Speaking of small ones, it seems important to know that the anatomy on these is more 'accurate' than most things for children. I attached a picture so you're not surprised like I was when first opening it.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy J. Trudeau

customer_reviews.title: Love it. Anatomically correct.
customer_reviews.text: Love this for home schooling and introducing body systems, also love that is anatomically correct in a non startling or overly graphic way. My 6 yr old daughter thinks it is cool and she got to see the skeletal structure in another view after getting to see an x-ray since she broke her toe. Very well made. Great value. 1st grader. Also. The organs differ male to female as well not just genitalia.
customer_reviews.author: Lindy

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful magnets of the human body!
customer_reviews.text: I think these magnets are great, my only complaint would be that the body itself is not magnetic even though all the other pieces are. It does come with a little stand for the body, but this is my second set of M&D magnets so I made the same addition to this one as I did last time- I happened to have some large magnetic sheets (they're supposed to be magnetic floor vent covers but I don't use them) I cut them into the shape of the body and glued them on with a strong epoxy. Now all the pieces can live on the fridge!
customer_reviews.author: Marla Singer

customer_reviews.title: Nice idea, not well executed
customer_reviews.text: It’s great that it’s a learning tool but the packaging makes it hard to use. The body part descriptions are on the back of the box so the contents have to be dumped to see them. The body part descriptions are limited and seem arbitrary. And there is no top for the box so there is no way to store it properly. Also the pieces are all made out of particle board which emits formaldehyde. This just isn’t appropriate for kids toys.
customer_reviews.author: SR

customer_reviews.title: Great puzzle, but contains penis/vagina/reproductive parts
customer_reviews.text: We homeschool so I bought this for my preschooler & 2nd grader to use while we study the human body this year. It's well made like all Melissa & Doug puzzles and they already love it. Just an FYI, though- it does have a vagina, penis, & the coordinating reproductive system. We have 2 daughters and a son so this isn't a problem for us because having a 1 year old boy running through the house naked evading his diaper change, they know what a penis is haha but important for adults who may not want their daughters learning about penises in preschool or vice versa.
customer_reviews.author: Forust Pearson

customer_reviews.title: So glad that I found this!!!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic! I was originally looking for an X-ray type puzzle to help teach basic anatomy to my toddler when I stumbled upon this. I love that it gives a visual for bones, muscles and major organs as well as very basic (external) male/female anatomy. We're beginning to have conversations about privacy and inappropriate touch, so I'm grateful to have an engaging toy that will help with those discussions. Thank you, Melissa and Doug!!!
customer_reviews.author: K.R.

customer_reviews.title: Something is not labeled correctly, but it’s sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: Overall this toy is great and the kids love it! Forwarding - there are private male and female parts shown if you can’t handle that then don’t buy it! Gave it three stars because they labeled a part wrong. I’m usually a big fan of the brand but they don’t show a full digestive system and mislabeled the trachea with esophagus.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanne

customer_reviews.title: weak magnets and  too many extra parts
customer_reviews.text: The magnets are much too weak to layer the pieces on the stand. The pieces are also thick and awkward to layer even when laid down. The pictures are nice and simple for showing body functions to small children. It seems like there are too many extra parts for boy/girl clothes and such; the design could be streamlined to offer other options at the same price point -like a lid for the box! Might be nice to include labeled charts for explaining and to come in other ethnicities
customer_reviews.author: Blue Violet

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't stack
customer_reviews.text: I love the idea of this for homeschooling and teach my kids about their body, however, I was really disappointed that the magnets didn't stack where I could show the different 'layers'. The magnet only sticks directly on the main body piece and nothing else can be stacked on top of that first magnet that you apply. The quality, otherwise, is very nice and rather nicely detailed.
customer_reviews.author: A. Drewes ❤ Product Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Children are SO Open to Learning
customer_reviews.text: My grandson loves this "toy." I bought it because of his interest in a "My Body" book that was his mother's when she was little. She's now a doctor and attributes that book to her early interest in anatomy. He's three and can tell you all about the skeleton, muscles, blood vessels, and organs, as well as the proper names for body parts. It's a great learning tool.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Shows private parts of a little girl and little boy
customer_reviews.text: This was definitely NOT shown on Toy, and its says ages 3 and UP!! I would definitely consider NOT getting this for certain kids! Shocked for my 7yr
customer_reviews.author: Stacey Whitley

customer_reviews.title: Things to be aware of
customer_reviews.text: this is a great and fun way to explore the human body. Be aware, however that there are anatomically correct pieces for the reproductive system and the skin level. In our classroom setting with 3-4 year olds, I removed some pieces because I knew not all parents would have been ok with it at this level. It would be great in a home-school setting--just not all of it worked in our group where its volunteer led with a diverse group of families.
customer_reviews.author: David Ulg

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: Beautifully made like all Melissa and Doug products. I'm using this to homeschool my 4 year old and she has enjoyed this toy. She learned things I hadn't even noticed with my adult eyes. This also helped us explain how blood works so when she got her first big bloody booboo, she wasn't nearly as upset as I thought she might be. She knew it was only blood and the knowledge helped her stay calm.
customer_reviews.author: Nerd

customer_reviews.title: Like others have said
customer_reviews.text: Just as pictured. Like others have said, you can not stack the pieces and have the magnets hold. I don't think this is a big deal at all. My children laid out the different systems on the table top and then "attached" whatever they felt like doing next.We used this during a comprehensive study of the human body. Worked out well.
customer_reviews.author: Sunny

customer_reviews.title: Good Item to add to Anatomy Unit
customer_reviews.text: So far we love this. The pieces seem strong and good quality. We are adding it to our homeschool class as part of our anatomy unit. It has the muscular system, nervous system, skeletal system, ect. They aren't named which I was hoping they were but still happy with it. It does have the male and female organs, which we are book with. If I could change one thing it would be for it to come with a lid of some sort. That way we can store it and none of the pieces fell out and got lost. I'm will have to be careful in storing it. But still love
customer_reviews.author: brian

customer_reviews.title: Great toy
customer_reviews.text: My son loves the human body and I thought this was a great gift for him. I've read some reviews about people bot liking that they have the boy parts and girl parts shown in the toy, but IT IS A HUMAN ANATOMY toy, so they have to learn the difference. I'm a doctor and I found this toy great for kids to learn about the human body and the superficial differences in girls and boys.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Pagan

customer_reviews.title: its ok
customer_reviews.text: Overall I like the idea of them but definitely wish you could stack them and have them all stick. I know given the size that labels would be hard but maybe have a book that went along with it would be nice. They're sturdy pieces. The other thing is that I wish there was more than one body for the base since my son wanted to play together with friends but it's hard when they can't each do it at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: Miso

customer_reviews.title: Great teach tool
customer_reviews.text: My granddaughter is into learning about bones and other things. I thought this would be good for her to learn more about the human body. She loves it and her mom does too. Mom said that both the 6 and 8yr are enjoying this and it has opened up learning more about taking care of your body.
customer_reviews.author: T. Joyner

customer_reviews.title: Wish it could have been a 5 star
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited for this toy. I love that it has actual body parts, that was part of the selling point to me. My daughter is 2, turns 3 in a few months and she really likes it. My only complaint is that you cannot build each piece on top of the next. I thought we be able to put guts, then muscle, then skin then clothes on top of each other. You cannot. So if we put the skin over the bones we cannot add clothes on top of the skin. Pretty big bummer. But overall it’s been well received by the kiddo and it’s a neat idea.
customer_reviews.author: Chirpitychirp

customer_reviews.title: Great but does show genitalia
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product, Melissa and Doug never disappoints! My only concern is that for a product that is listed as 3+, there is one layer showing the exterior genitalia. Although I agree, teaching children about the genitalia and the reproductive systems is important, I don’t know if 3 may be a little young. Personally I was a little nervous so I took a sharpie and colored a bathing suit on the exterior pieces for the opposite sex. Just a warning in case you may be surprised when opening the product.
customer_reviews.author: Sam_Maddox

customer_reviews.title: Read the Description, Check the Photos
customer_reviews.text: My wife ordered this for our nephew, he’s 4. She did not get a good look at the photos or read through the reviews so it was a big surprise today when she discovered the pieces were anatomically correct and had to answer why the piece had a ‘wiener’ to a 4 year old cousin. Hilarity ensued of course. The adults giggled, the pieces were hidden for now, but our nephew loves building his person so it’s a hit. Now my wife is checking over the toy she got him for Christmas.
customer_reviews.author: kyle messer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing educational toy!
customer_reviews.text: My 3-year old granddaughter is really enjoying this toy. I have to admit that I was amazed at her interest at such a young age. She seems to be grasping the overall concept of the complexity of the human body. She already names the organs and makes reference to her own body. This has also helped her see the difference between the boy and girl body. Excellent product - both in quality of construction as well as anatomical details. I have to admit that I've learned some things myself :). Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Kathy

customer_reviews.title: Nice Magnetic Play Set
customer_reviews.text: I haven't found a Melissa & Doug item that I don't like. This magnetic play set is well made and my kids love it. I will mention that my husband and I were a little surprised with the "very accurate" male & female private body parts. It was a good reminder on what we all need to teach our kids at an early age. I might not gift this for a birthday party but will buy it for kids of close friends and family members.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie S.

customer_reviews.title: My daughter loves it. She loves to layer the ...
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves it. She loves to layer the pieces. The only surprise I received which should not really have been a surprise was that it shows the boy and girl anatomy. I wasn't really concerned because I want her to learn, but just a precaution for all those not ready to discuss the topic yet.
customer_reviews.author: Vaan1891

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: What a great toy. My 6 year old absolutely loves studying the different body options on this toy. Especially the muscles and veins. Yes, there was initial giggling about the male and female private parts, but it became a non issue after we talked about it (again).
customer_reviews.author: Henrietta

customer_reviews.title: Just a Dress Up Doll
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping the organ systems would layer. I had hoped that the base doll was a skeleton and that you could add the organs or the circulatory on top of that, etc until you reached the final layer of skin. It does not work like that. It is a skeleton and then you have to choose one system to place on top of it at a time. Basically they took their base construction for a dress up doll and printed body parts on the pieces instead of clothes. This setup does a poor job of facilitating a conversation about anatomy.
customer_reviews.author: H. J. Smith

customer_reviews.title: A simple, easy-to-use educational toy that draws kids interest. Can be enjoyed solo or with others.
customer_reviews.text: I got this gift for my five year old grandson. He has shown an interest in animal anatomy I.e. the digestive system. This play set is perfect. It helps him see how things are arranged in the body, the systems (he really loves the blood vessels) and yet it is simple enough for a 5 year old. He enjoys telling me the things he has learned. I appreciate the anatomically correct figure; he knows the boy/girl difference, and it is no big deal, whereas missing parts could cause concern. The figure is sturdy, and the magnets hold well. I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy H.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent toy
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my 3 year old grandson. He broke his leg several months ago (trampoline park...never again), and he developed a fascination with xrays and the inner workings of the hunan body. He loves this. The pieces are sturdy and easy to handle for small hands. He loves that it's magnetic. I would give it 5 stars if only it came with better storage to keep all the pieces together. The tray is fine but it could really use a lid that closes.
customer_reviews.author: R. Kintz

customer_reviews.title: Internal genital organs pictured and basic external genitals. Don’t gift to another family! Lol
customer_reviews.text: Good for our house since we are medically minded and teach our children different body parts (we have to with three young littles both boy and girls), but I would never give as a gift. Magnets include: two with basic genitals as they would look under clothes, and two with internal genital organs pictured. We threw those away since we have nieces and nephews visit often and don’t want to have a talk with other kids about those things...
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Schmitz

customer_reviews.title: Warning- these are atomically correct
customer_reviews.text: First off the box came cracked so that was a bummer. Then I noticed that the male and female are atomically correct, I threw away these parts. I ordered this for the muscular systems and organs so it’s not that big of a deal, I kept those “layers”. Be warned, Idk if it’s in description I didn’t read it if it was.
customer_reviews.author: ally2

customer_reviews.title: 5 stars across the board!
customer_reviews.text: 5 stars across the board! One of the main reasons I purchased this magnetic puzzle was because it was anatomically correct! It is SO hard to find toys/educational toys that are anatomically correct let alone quality ones. Both my almost 3 yo and my 6 yo like the puzzle very much but it will be used at a homeschool tool as much as for fun. It is sturdy and the magnet is strong, very nice box and overall very well made.
customer_reviews.author: Audrey

customer_reviews.title: Great teaching tool!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for starting the conversation of girl and boy anatomy discussions, along with discussions about clothing choice for the sexes. I tell my kids they can mix and match girl and boy clothing for any sex. Let each kid be who they want to be without ridicule! And I told them some kids are born with both or ambiguous sexual body parts, and that it doesn’t matter because we should love everyone equally.
customer_reviews.author: Shelley

customer_reviews.title: It is okay.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my kids for a science activity. Quality is nice and idea is great, however, I would have liked to see it have teaching tips or definitions/details about each set of magnets. It was kind of a let down in that way.
customer_reviews.author: Clara

customer_reviews.title: Great toy!
customer_reviews.text: I love your products! My 5 year old talks about being a doctor all the time & this was perfect for her! She loves it! It also helps her understand her body more, & that everything has a function, a job, so it's important to stay healthy. But one question: why don't you have covers for items such as these? Would solve losing pieces tremendously. Other than that, my kids love your toys! This & the pizza pie are their favorites!
customer_reviews.author: Catherine S.

customer_reviews.title: his mom is a nurse and she loved that these were accurate and well done
customer_reviews.text: gave this as a gift to our nephew. his mom is a nurse and she loved that these were accurate and well done. and of course, they are Melissa and Doug, so they are great quality, hold up well to kid wear and tear and can be passed along after being outgrown bc Melissa and Doug stuff lasts!
customer_reviews.author: R. Foster

customer_reviews.title: Great toy
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t give 5 stars for giftable because it Is anatomically correct. So I would just check with the parents First to see of there ok with it. For my son, he was very interested medically. I used it as an opportunity to explain the difference between girls and boys since he doesn’t have a sister. Great gift for a child interested in the human body and how it works
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra

customer_reviews.title: My daughter and wife are having a blast!
customer_reviews.text: This product is of good quality, which comes as no surprise since Melissa and Doug toys usually are. My wife is in the medical field and my daughter is 2 years old. We received these yesterday and theyve been playing with them since! my wife enjoys the accuracy and my daughter enjous the fact that they are magnetic and come with so many different pieces. Overall we are satisfied with this product! Thank you
customer_reviews.author: "A" Family

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: This toy is great for introducing young children to the differences between male and female body parts as well as body systems. Also good to use for general matching activity. My only complaint, as is with all these Melissa & Doug play sets are the fact that they don't ever have a lid and therefore lend themselves to some serious closet spills and messes. The use of wood rather than plastic is also nice and makes this a bit more durable and eco friendly.
customer_reviews.author: caren schwartz

customer_reviews.title: Great for Kids Yoga
customer_reviews.text: My bestie and I are yoga teachers. Often when we get together we talk yoga, do yoga, and chat about anatomy. Her 3 year old daughter joins in and is now starting to figure out yoga helps you from the inside out. This toy is a fun toy to have out on the yoga mat if you are home practicing with children around. You can teach kids the why, how, and where as you practice with them.
customer_reviews.author: PonchoLady

customer_reviews.title: "Look Ma different parts!!"
customer_reviews.text: Really enjoyed this product for teaching my son the different body systems. it's kind of a fun play around toy while we're doing our home lessons. it is atomically correct on the bottoms for the lower organs and skin layers, but it led into a wonderful explanation of the two genders and what makes them different. Although the lower atomically correct parts of the skin layer does look a little funny compared to real life, but super kid friendly in that aspect.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Rozell

customer_reviews.title: Colorful and fun
customer_reviews.text: I bought this puzzle to use in my k/1 grade class as we learn about systems of the body I took out the skin layer that depicted anatomically correct boy and girl parts. The students enjoy putting together the skeleto the circulatory system etc. This puzzle is very sturdy it should last for years I would buy it again
customer_reviews.author: Sandra H.

customer_reviews.title: Not a huge fan
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my son for Christmas. They haven’t been a hit. It would be better if all of it was magnetic and you could actually layer the different body systems on top of each other. Also the storage solution isn’t great.
customer_reviews.author: Bree

customer_reviews.title: Lovely anatomy set for toddlers
customer_reviews.text: These are very nice little magnets that you can use as puzzles or explain how human body works. They even have boy and girl anatomy shown. I think it would be even nicer if you could stack all the layers but the magnets are not strong enough.
customer_reviews.author: MEW

customer_reviews.title: My son actually like this activity!
customer_reviews.text: I have loved this little activity. My son, who is 4, will actually sit down to use this. He is very active and doesn't normally like these types of things, but he loves this one. I also like the way it's organized. He enjoys putting everything away in their little spots when he is finished.
customer_reviews.author: amazon mom

customer_reviews.title: My kid is impressed with it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this game reading the reviews beforehand. I lile the fact that they actually show the genitals, so we had a discussion about how boys and girls are different. He was more interested in the muscular system though 🙂 Multiple layers won't hold, only one at a time. I would have liked this game to have a lid in order to keep all the pieces in place, but that's no such big deal. I recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: D.B.

customer_reviews.title: Toy has penis, vagina, uterus, and ovaries. So be mindful of the age you are buying for
customer_reviews.text: This detail is mentioned in the product description, but I over-looked. So if you are doofy like me and didn't see it... THIS TOY IS ANATOMICALLY CORRECT WITH THE GENITALS. And the female set has a uterus and ovaries. This isn't a bad thing, but it's something to be aware of before purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: Lizzie

customer_reviews.title: Product has a defect.
customer_reviews.text: Product has a defect. I received 2 right feet for the little girl instead of a left and a right foot. The boy has the correct feet. It is minor but still really annoying for my 2 year old. Otherwise, a nice anatomy learning tool.
customer_reviews.author: Derek Melton

customer_reviews.title: Love this puzzle...but what's up with the lidless box?
customer_reviews.text: This is a great puzzle and was fun to use as we studied different body systems. With that said, I wish the storage tray came with a lid and that the two sets of clothing weren't so stereotypical "boy" (blue) and "girl" (pink). However, all in all, it was a great purchase and was a fun hands-on way to review body systems with younger kids.
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Magnets are week! But overall great educational experience.
customer_reviews.text: This cute educational magnetic body is adorable, however the magnets are not strong enough to stack. Only one can be put on the skeleton at a time. That was very disappointing. Still great fun. My children really enjoy it. I love how they included male and female organs and outer body parts.
customer_reviews.author: MamaWilliams

customer_reviews.title: Human Body
customer_reviews.text: Lovely concept! However I am disappointed that the parts of the body are not labeled individually for the kids. The box has a picture of them in the back which is not Convenient when teaching the parts of the body! The box is not meant to securely store the parts
customer_reviews.author: Veronica

customer_reviews.title: Good for little doctors
customer_reviews.text: I thought our grandkids would love this as they are fascinated by anatomy/science/medicine. They like the other dolls but this one was sort of bleh to them. Surprised me! But it is very well built.
customer_reviews.author: the girls

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful teaching aid
customer_reviews.text: This serves as a great learning companion for children studying basic anatomy. Our son is in second grade and this has been a great tool for him to understand and explore the many layers of the body. Manipulatives make learning fun and the lesson resonates. Very nice quality.
customer_reviews.author: M_Ammons

customer_reviews.title: Really great learning tool
customer_reviews.text: Great to help kids understand how our bodies are made of layers and different systems. The examples are prepubescent so the conversations are not overly awkward every time you put it together.
customer_reviews.author: Amber Bush

customer_reviews.title: My Grandson Loved It!
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, whenever I see a Melissa and Doug toy I buy it. They are high-quality toys and spark my grandson's imagination every time. We've spent hours playing with their barn, the human skeleton and the dress-up outfit playset. We've also spent endless hours creating sandwiches to eat with the felt sandwich kit. If I could be their spokesperson I would gladly do it. High quality, imaginative toys that are timeless.
customer_reviews.author: jacqueline

customer_reviews.title: Great educational fun
customer_reviews.text: My 3 year old daughter loves playing "the body game". She asks lots of questions about the different layers of systems in the human body. She's learning and having a great time.
customer_reviews.author: Sitakatherine

customer_reviews.title: So much fun for a 6 year old
customer_reviews.text: My 6 year old is very curious about anatomy of the human body right now and he absolutely loved this play set. I actually like that it's anatomically correct. Nothing over the top, though, it's not pornographic or anything, very innocent.
customer_reviews.author: Julia Laky

customer_reviews.title: Layers don’t stick to each other
customer_reviews.text: The different anatomy layers do not stick to each other. I really wish they did, to show the different systems of the body and how they all go together.
customer_reviews.author: Dana

customer_reviews.title: Great Learning Tool!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome gift for my niece! She's learning a lot from it. Extra points that now she can ask her mommy very ummm..."fun" question regarding male and female anatomy.
customer_reviews.author: Drakelb

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for a 9 year old & his little bro
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for a nine year old who loves to play school. And I am happy to report that it survived a birthday party with 10 sugar crazed demons. Nice, simple, educational.
customer_reviews.author: Shauna

customer_reviews.title: Very educational and so fun
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this body magnet set. Seriously. It does have all the body parts for both male and female so know this when getting it for littles. I love all the layers of skin, muscles, bones, nervous system/veins. It was so so fun to go along with our body study!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Racer

customer_reviews.title: Great Gift
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my days few years ago and she enjoyed it so much I bought one for my nephew too. It’s such a great gift that will definitely get used.
customer_reviews.author: jenna

customer_reviews.title: Male and Female Private Parts are present
customer_reviews.text: I bought this so my child could learn human anatomy-well female and male parts are very present. I know for some parents this might not be a concern, but my daughter is 4 and I'm not ready for those questions! Just wanted to forewarn some parents!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: very nice , short in service
customer_reviews.text: This product did not have name in the pieces, so at list could be more educational for the kid play and learn at same time.
customer_reviews.author: SANDRA F.

customer_reviews.title: So fun and educational!
customer_reviews.text: This toy is so awesome. My 1 and 2 year olds love it, but I can see a 3 or 4 year old having fun with it too. Daddy is a doctor, so we're all about anatomy in this house. This toy is so much fun, and my 1 year old is already talking about "muscles" and "bones". I love that it is magnetic, and that it has anatomically correct boy and girl bodies.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Lambdin

customer_reviews.title: Not Durable
customer_reviews.text: Looks great, kids love it. One child covered the boy's head in watery play dough the 2nd day in use and the picture melted off. Other than that ok.
customer_reviews.author: Janice Roome

customer_reviews.title: Tastefully teaching the human body to a preschooler
customer_reviews.text: Great for the curious child that wants to learn more about their body in a tasteful manner. I removed the girl magnets so my son could understand his body better. The vains and heart, skeleton, organs and “skin” provides lot of discussions
customer_reviews.author: Katie B.

customer_reviews.title: the storage box is a waist. I would rate the product 3.5
customer_reviews.text: the product is ok. the storage try has no lid, so there is nothing to keep the loos parts in place, no can you put anything on top of it. The doll is small, hard to use with more than one child at a time. My 7 yr old was interested in the male parts of a doll :)
customer_reviews.author: Irene

customer_reviews.title: Met expectations.
customer_reviews.text: That great Melissa & Doug quality. Kid even got it wet & it's still in great condition. Easy to use, no missing pieces, & a great teachable toy.
customer_reviews.author: Mel

customer_reviews.title: Not anatomically correct.
customer_reviews.text: It is not anatomically correct. The bones on the fingers are wrong. The feet are missing a whole set of bones. So disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Anne Guryn

customer_reviews.title: A good learning tool
customer_reviews.text: A good learning tool. However, the magnets won't layer and stick together on the skeleton. I bought this for my grandchild and she wanted to build the different anatomy parts on top of each other but they don't stay on.
customer_reviews.author: DMM

customer_reviews.title: Educational and good size
customer_reviews.text: You can only attach one layer of parts to the big skeleton. The way this would have work better is if you can use the magnet to attach them all, one of top of each other the way the human body works: Organs first, then attach the veins and arteries and so on. Still cute though. My 3 year old loves to play with it.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: Prefect
customer_reviews.text: It’s a nice set, would recommend for kids interested in learning about the body along with “Me & My Amazing Body” book. FYI - This does show boy & girl private parts. Wasn’t expecting that but luckily bc of baby cousin my daughter already knew & it wasn’t an issue that needed explaining. Just wish it had a nice protective cover for storing other than the flimsy plastic. Added pic of book in comments.
customer_reviews.author: Natasha Vallet

customer_reviews.title: My kids like it...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item as a birthday gift for my daughter. She uses it about once or twice a month with her 3 year brother. They like to play with it on the refrigerator.
customer_reviews.author: Lixie M.

customer_reviews.title: Great learning tool, needs a lid though
customer_reviews.text: Good quality overall, I just wish it came with a lid to the box to keep pieces in there. My 4 yo has had fun putting the bodies together im various ways and asking questions. Which was the point of getting it.
customer_reviews.author: Kal

customer_reviews.title: Both of his parents are massage therapists so he is pretty knowledgable about the human body
customer_reviews.text: My nephew LOVES this thing! Both of his parents are massage therapists so he is pretty knowledgable about the human body. It also has male and female organs and "parts" too, which I didn't know when I bought it. Was fine for him and his parents, but other parents might not be too crazy about that.
customer_reviews.author: Megen

customer_reviews.title: Great visual learning tool for kids
customer_reviews.text: I love Melissa & Doug products so I knew I wouldn't be taking a huge chance ordering this. Like most of their toys, it's well made. It doesn't feel like cheap material that won't last. Hope to get a few good years of use out of this.
customer_reviews.author: Dice

customer_reviews.title: Great, anatomically correct for teaching the littles - if only it had a lid or cover it would be 5 stars
customer_reviews.text: Love this set for our 4 and 6 year old to learn about the body. Would give 5 stars if there was a cover or lid. It's too easy to lose the pieces for the M&D Magnetic People to not have a cover or other containment method. We have several others (a boy, girl, and a Santa) and they all "live" in ziplok bags to prevent loss.
customer_reviews.author: A Doggie Mama

customer_reviews.title: Needs a lid
customer_reviews.text: I love the Melissa and Doug sets like this, but not having a lid for all those tiny parts is super annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Rowan & Graham

customer_reviews.title: Educational and fun
customer_reviews.text: My kids love playing with this! It really sparked an interest in learning about the human body. 5/5
customer_reviews.author: Caitlyn Bobbitt

customer_reviews.title: Great for kids!
customer_reviews.text: My 5 yo grand triplets are interested in human anatomy and this puzzle toy entertains them while they learn placement and names of internal organs. The anatomically correct feature is a plus.
customer_reviews.author: Dale T. Milne

customer_reviews.title: Not happy with it
customer_reviews.text: My 3and a half year old liked it and played with it 2 times and was not interested in playing with it any more. So it's not a game that will keep them busy and interested for a long period of time
customer_reviews.author: jane

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product for age appropriate education
customer_reviews.text: 4yr old son has learned, maybe more than me, about the body recently so I purchased this for him and he has loved it. Great durable product and not worried about it breaking. Would definitely buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Shekinah Govero

customer_reviews.title: Skin Puzzle Pc Includes Genitals
customer_reviews.text: Super helpful with the kids I preschool co-op. We are learning about the body’s system and how we work. Fair warning - the “skin” puzzle does show male / female parts. The kids I have are 4 so it wasn’t too big of an issue, but it was still a surprise to the other parents and myself.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria

customer_reviews.title: Great Toy
customer_reviews.text: My 4 years old she loves playing with it she knows a lot about the human body and she even teach her little brother how it works (2 years old)
customer_reviews.author: Marylee Robinson

customer_reviews.title: They love it!
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I bought this for our boys for homeschool. They love it!! The quality is great and they love that they can change all of the pieces to make different pictures. It comes in a super sturdy box that we use to store it on their bookshelf in the homeschool room!! The pieces are magnetic so it helps them keep them in place. Our family loves melissa and doug products!! They are one of our top go to brands for toys!! Worth your money, and I would buy this product again!!
customer_reviews.author: L

customer_reviews.title: Not bad, overall good product
customer_reviews.text: I thought the skeletal part would be able to go on the fridge with the rest of it but it doesn't, daughter still loves to play with it though so that's what counts
customer_reviews.author: Sonja Kay Allen

customer_reviews.title: Exellent for learning.
customer_reviews.text: From the mother of the recipient: I'm not going to lie this is one of the best gifts my daughter Emma got this year for her birthday! I have been trying to teach Emma all her body part/bones and this is helping sooo much!!! She already knows all of her major bones: femur, tibia and fibula, humerus, ribs, skull, phalanges, etc! I am sooo proud of her!
customer_reviews.author: Patricia L. Walsh

customer_reviews.title: another excellent product from Melissa & Doug
customer_reviews.text: another excellent product from Melissa & Doug. I used it as prizes for the children that answered questions correctly at career day in school talking about the human body. I only bought 3. I wish I could buy several more, but there was a 3 purchase limit. Not sure why!!
customer_reviews.author: Bon

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: What acute toy. Clever snd Education I am never disappointed by melissa snd Doug.
customer_reviews.author: marymak

customer_reviews.title: Educational
customer_reviews.text: Shows all body parts. We are religious and don't mind. We used it with our homeschooling curriculum as a fun add on.
customer_reviews.author: A. Maria

customer_reviews.title: Magnets aren’t strong enough!
customer_reviews.text: The madness aren’t strong enough to layer making this not as useful as it could have been if it was.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Yikes!
customer_reviews.text: I love Mellisa & Doug toys for sure. I was super surprised when I saw that some of the pieces were anatomically correct.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 2 year old grandson who is always asking questions - lately about the inside of his body. This is perfect to show him and explain to him how his body works.
customer_reviews.author: J. G.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Great product for little ones who are interested in the human body and anatomy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very educational!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves this! Just a heads up in case parents don’t notice, the reproductive organs are present on some of the magnets. They aren’t obscene and are anatomically accurate. Just wanted to put that out there before someone is completely outraged by it.
customer_reviews.author: Wes Wiens

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and well-loved
customer_reviews.text: We own several of these sets from M&D. They’re sturdy, don’t peel, and hold up over time. Have purchased several as gifts and they’ve always been a hit. This anatomy one was a really neat find, we’ve only found the career/princess/animal ones in stores, so I’m happy we found this one for my mini Dr!
customer_reviews.author: Alannah Coley

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Educational Toy
customer_reviews.text: 4 year old loves assembling this in all the different layers.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah S.

customer_reviews.title: Anatomically correct
customer_reviews.text: I love it I just wish it wasn't pink and blue for the boy and girl
customer_reviews.author: Sprentice

customer_reviews.title: Good educational toy
customer_reviews.text: Pieces are a little thicker than I imagined. Good for small hands, but not as "paper doll" like as I had imagined. Very educational and excellent quality, though!
customer_reviews.author: Scarlett

customer_reviews.title: Great learning tool
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves learning the different body systems and how boys and girls are the same and how they are different.
customer_reviews.author: Karmen Russell

product_meta.title: Melissa & Doug Magnetic Human Body Play Set
product_meta.description:
Better than X-ray vision, this magnetic wooden figure is a fantastic learning aid Help children visualize the skeleton, internal organs, circulatory system, and more, by placing magnets on the body. The set includes anatomically correct magnets for boys and girls, along with a wooden stand. This Melissa & Doug magnetic human anatomy set is both entertaining and educational. Each piece is made from high-quality materials and features beautiful artwork. The pieces are divided into middle torso, body and head, and bottom with legs. This 24-piece magnetic set helps children visualize the different systems of the human body, such as the internal organs, skeleton, circulatory system, and more. It also promotes hand-eye coordination, creative expression, and imaginative play. The Melissa & Doug Magnetic Human Body Anatomy Playset makes an exceptional gift for kids. Add the Melissa & Doug Bug-Catching Magnetic Puzzle to round out the hands-on, screen-free play experience. For more than 30 years, Melissa & Doug has created beautifully designed imagination- and creativity-sparking products that NBC News called “the gold standard in early childhood play.” Today, Melissa & Doug is proudly partnering with the American Academy of Pediatrics to foster early brain development and help children build important life skills through play.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
From classic wooden toys to crafts, pretend play, and games, Melissa & Doug products provide a launch pad to ignite imagination and a sense of wonder in all children so they can discover themselves, their passions, and their purpose. 

Since the company’s founding more than 25 years ago, Melissa & Doug has consistently delivered innovative products that inspire open-ended thinking, encourage kids to see new possibilities, and offer Countless Ways to Play. It’s part of a bigger vision to Take Back Childhood. Because by giving children a true childhood with the space and freedom to explore their world, we give them a path to realizing their full potential!
feature_bullets: MAGNETIC HUMAN BODY PLAY SET: The Melissa & Doug Magnetic Human Body Anatomy Playset features 24 magnetic pieces that help kids visualize the body’s systems and organs.
ANATOMICALLY CORRECT MAGNETS: This human body puzzle features anatomically correct magnets for boys and girls, along with a wooden stand for easy use.

HELPS DEVELOP MULTIPLE SKILLS: This Melissa & Doug body puzzle set helps children visualize the body’s systems and organs. It also promotes hand-eye coordination, creative expression, and imaginative play.

GREAT GIFT FOR KIDS: The Melissa & Doug Magnetic Human Body Anatomy Playset makes an exceptional gift for kids. Add the Melissa & Doug Bug-Catching Magnetic Puzzle to round out the hands-on, screen-free play experience.

“THE GOLD STANDARD IN CHILDHOOD PLAY”: For more than 30 years, Melissa & Doug has created beautifully designed imagination- and creativity-sparking products that NBC News called “the gold standard in early childhood play.”

100% HAPPINESS GUARANTEE: We design every toy to the highest quality standards, and to nurture minds and hearts. If your child is not inspired, give us a call and we’ll make it right. Our phone number is on every product
